name: Phosphorus
Relationship: Antidote: Antidote to Phosph. Poisoning: TURPENTINE with which it forms an insoluble mass. Also POTASS PERMANG. NUX. PHOS. antidotes the nausea and vomiting of CHLOROFORM and ether.Complementary: ARS.; CEPA; LYC.; SILICA. SANGUISUGA 30 - Leech - (PERSISTENT HEMORRHAGES; effects of use of leeches.) PHOSPH. PENTACHLORIDE (great soreness of mucous membrane of EYES and nose, throat and chest sore).Compare: TUBERCULINUM follows PHOSPHOR well and complements its action. PHOSPHORUS HYDROGENATUS (crumbling teeth; hyperesthesia; locomotor ataxia); AMPHISBAENA (right jaw swollen and painful). THYMOL (Typical sexual neurasthenia; irritable stomach; aching throughout lumbar region; worse, mental and physical exertion); CALC.; CHIN.; ANTIM.; SEP.; LYC.; SULPH. In Pneumonia, Pneumococin 200 and Pneumotoxin (Cahis) taken from the Diplococcus lanceolatus of Fraenkel. Pneumonia and paralytic phenomena; pleuritic pain and pain in ilio-coecal region (Cartier).Incompatible: CAUST.
Modalities: Worse: touch; physical or mental exertion; twilight; warm food or drink; change of weather
Worse: from getting wet in hot weather; evening; lying on left or painful side; during a thunder-storm; ascending stairs
Better: cold food; cold; open air; washing with cold water; sleep

Urine: Hematuria, especially in acute bright's disease
Stool: Long, narrow, hard, like a dog's
Discharge of blood from rectum, during stool
Desire for stool on lying on left side
Involuntary; seems as if anus remained open
Green mucus, with grains like sago
Head: Brain-fag, with coldness of occiput
Vertigo, with faintness
Skin of forehead feels too tight
Itching of scalp, dandruff, falling out of hair in large bunches
Neuralgia; parts must be kept warm
Vertigo of the aged, after rising
Heat comes from spine
Chronic congestion of head
Burning pains
Fever: Adynamic with lack of thirst, but unnatural hunger
Hectic, with small, quick pulse; viscid night-sweats
Stomach: Region of stomach painful to touch, or on walking
Throws up ingesta by the mouthfuls
Belching large quantities of wind, after eating
Inflammation of stomach, with burning extending to throat and bowels
Bad effects of eating too much salt
Vomiting; water is thrown up as soon as it gets warm in the stomach
Sour taste and sour eructations after every meal
Pain in stomach; relieved by cold food, ices
Cardiac opening seems contracted, too narrow; the food scarcely swallowed, comes up again
Abdomen: A very weak, empty, gone sensation felt in whole abdominal cavity
Mouth: Swelled and easily bleeding gums, ulcerated
Tongue dry, smooth, red or white, not thickly coated
Respiratory: Tightness across chest; great weight on chest
Cannot talk on account of pain in larynx
Sharp stitches in chest; respiration quickened, oppressed
Cough from tickling in throat; worse, cold air, reading, laughing, talking, from going from warm room into cold air
Pneumonia, with oppression; worse, lying on left side
Clergyman's sore throat; violent tickling in larynx while speaking
Do not give it too low or too frequently here, it may but hasten the destructive degeneration of tubercular masses
Tuberculosis in tall, rapidly-growing young people
Burning pains, heat and oppression of chest
Nervous coughs provoked by strong odors, entrance of a stranger; worse in the presence of strangers; worse lying upon left side; in cold room
Eyes: Sensation as if everything were covered with a mist or veil, or something pulled tightly over eyes
Diplopia, due to deviation of the visual axis
Degenerative changes where soreness and curved lines are seen in old people
Patient sees better by shading eyes with hand
Oedema of lids and about eyes
Thrombosis of retinal vessels and degenerative changes in retinal cells
Retinal trouble with lights and hallucination of vision
Fatigue of eyes and head even without much use of eyes
Black points seem to float before the eyes
Pearly white conjunctiva and long curved lashes
Partial loss of vision from abuse of tobacco
Face: Swelling and necrosis of lower jaw
Tearing pain in facial bones; circumscribed redness in one or both cheeks
Pale, sickly, complexion; blue rings under eyes
Nose: Chronic catarrh, with small hemorrhages; handkerchief is always bloody
Male: Irresistible desire; involuntary emissions, with lascivious dreams
Ears: Hearing difficult, especially to human voice
Heart: Violent palpitation with anxiety, while lying on left side
Mind: Fearfulness, as if something were creeping out of every corner
Insanity, with an exaggerated idea of one's own importance
Back: Burning in back; pain as if broken
Sleep: Vivid dreams of fire; of hemorrhage
Goes to sleep late and awakens weak
Female: Leucorrhoea profuse, smarting, corrosive, instead of menses
Suppuration of mammae, burning, water, offensive discharge
Menses too early and scanty - not profuse, but last too long
Slight hemorrhage from uterus between periods
Skin: Little ulcer outside of large ones
Wounds bleed very much, even if small; they heal and break out again
Extremities: Can scarcely hold anything with his hands
Stitches in elbow and shoulder joints
Can lie only on right side
Ascending sensory and motor paralysis from ends of fingers and toes
Weakness and trembling, from every exertion
Post-diphtheritic paralysis, with formication of hands and feet

details: Produces a picture of destructive metabolism. Causes yellow atrophy of the liver and sub-acute hepatitis. Tall, slender persons, narrow chested, with thin, transparent skin, weakened by loss of animal fluids, with great nervous debility, emaciation, amative tendencies, seem to be under the special influence of Phosphorus. Great susceptibility to external impressions, to light, sound, odors, touch, electrical changes, thunder-storms. SUDDENNESS of symptoms, sudden prostration, faints, sweats, shooting pains, etc. Polycythemia. Blood extravasations; FATTY DEGENERATIONS, cirrhosis, caries, are pathological states often calling for Phosphorus. Muscular pseudo-hypertrophy, neuritis. Inflammation of the respiratory tract. Paralytic symptoms. Ill effects of Iodine and excessive use of salt; worse, LYING ON LEFT SIDE. Tertiary syphilis, skin lesions, and nervous debility. SCURVY. PSEUDO-HYPERTROPHIC PARALYSIS. Ataxia and adynamia. Osteo myelitis. Bone fragility.Phosphorus irritates, inflames and degenerates mucous membranes, irritates and inflames serous membranes, inflames spinal cord and nerves, causing paralysis, destroys bone, especially the lower jaw and tibia; disorganizes the blood, causing fatty degeneration of blood vessels and every tissue and organ of the body and thus gives rise to hemorrhages, and hematogenous jaundice.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency. Should not be given too low or in too continuous doses. Especially in tuberculous cases. It may act as Euthanasia here.
